text:
“Did you see the painters?” Porfiry asked.

Raskolnikov hesitated. “No, I didn’t see them.”

Razumihin frowned. “It was the day of the murder!”

Porfiry slapped his forehead. “I’ve muddled it! This is turning my brain!”

Raskolnikov felt a wave of anxiety. He racked his memory. 

“On the fourth storey,” he said slowly, “someone was moving out.”

“Porters carried a sofa,” he continued. “But no painters. No flat was open.”

Porfiry sighed, frustration evident. “We need to find out if anyone saw them.”

Silence hung in the air. Raskolnikov drew a deep breath.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov anxiously navigates a conversation with Porfiry about the details surrounding a murder, trying to avoid revealing his knowledge of the crime.
